definition: (idiom) you can't rely on a verbal agreement/just because sb says sth, doesn't mean it's true
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof

sentences.english: The mouth says, seeing is believing.

definition: mere verbal statement cannot be taken as proof (idiom)

pinyin: shi4 shi2 sheng4 yu2 xiong2 bian4

definition: Take what you hear to be false, only believe it when you see it (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: er3 ting1 wei2 xu1 , yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2

definition: one side of the story/one-sided statement
to believe what one sees, not what one hears (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2 , er3 ting1 wei2 xu1

definition: to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
absolutely true (idiom)/manifold/true from many points of view

pinyin: zhen1 jin1 bu4 pa4 huo3 lian4
